title: Particle motion from graph of v part - b

content.description: A particle moves along the x-axis so that its velocity at time t, for 0 ≤ t ≤ 6, is given by a differentiable function v whose graph is shown above. The velocity is 0 at t = 0, t = 3, and t = 5, and the graph has horizontal tangents at t = 1 and t = 4. The areas of the regions bounded by the t-axis and the graph of v on the intervals [0,3], [3,5], and [5,6] are 8, 3, and 2 respectively. At time t = 0, the particle is x = −2.
content.question: For how many values of t, where 0 ≤ t≤ 6 , is the particle at x = −8 ? Explain your reasoning.

frqParts.text: For how many values of t, where 0 ≤ t≤ 6 , is the particle at x = −8 ? Explain your reasoning.

topic.text: 1.16: Working with the Intermediate Value Theorem (IVT)

skill.text: Skill 1.D: Identify an appropriate mathematical rule or procedure based on the relationship between concepts (e.g., rate of change and accumulation) or processes (e.g., differentiation and its inverse process, anti-differentiation) to solve problems.
